scenario 1.background: George is approaching a border checkpoint, feeling confident due to his past experiences with such situations. He is on his way to meet Sophia, who is waiting on the other side.

dialogue.George: I always find these checkpoints to be pretty smooth. Just need to have everything in order and it goes fast.
dialogue.Sophia: That's good to hear! I'll be waiting. Just text me when you're through.

dialogue.George: Sophia, it looks like this might take longer than I thought. The line is huge and people don't seem happy.
dialogue.Sophia: Oh no, that sounds stressful. Keep me posted, and take care!

dialogue.Officer: Let me see what I can do. Sometimes we can expedite for valid reasons.

dialogue.George: Thank you for considering my situation. I really appreciate any help you can provide.

scenario 5.background: The officer comes back with good news, allowing George to pass through more quickly than expected. George feels relieved and grateful.
